newsitem.title: USA: Alumax says low aluminum prices hurt '96 net.
newsitem.headline: Alumax says low aluminum prices hurt '96 net.

text.p: Alumax Inc's lower operating results for 1996 compared with a year earlier was mainly due to lower aluminum prices and higher raw materials costs, the company's chairman, Allen Born, said.

Born, in a statement that contained the company's earnings for the year and fiscal fourth quarter, said, however, that world primary aluminium consumption appears "ready to resume its upward trend in 1997 after two years of essentially flat demand."
He added that, "That's important because we've actively managed our asset base to improve our business and product mix."
He also said the company has positioned its businesses for better future growth in low-cost primary aluminum, specialized value-added products, transportation and emerging global markets.
The company did not provide specific details.
The company said Tuesday it earned $0.34 per share in the fourth quarter, compared with $0.94 in the year-ago period.
